contents.raw_html_text:
With a naturally varied terrain, Hallock Park Preserve contains many wonderful trails to hike or enjoy a nature walk. Not all trails in the park are used by humans alone! As you hike you may find signs of deer, possums, turkeys, and other animals that live in the park along the hiking trails. Hallock Park contains a natural bluff facing Long Island sound.

Head down to the beach to walk along and enjoy the beachfront. On a clear day, Connecticut is clearly visible on the other side of the sound. While walking along the beach you may come across Piping Plover, a threatened bird species in New York State.

Inland, hiking will take you through the woods where you may discover Hallock Pond - freshwater pond formed by glacial activity thousands of years ago. Today, it is a popular drinking spot for animals. As you continue hiking through the woods you will eventually reach scenic vistas with beautiful views from the bluffs across the sound.
